result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron W. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain FTE/schooling or combination.  If not, 10 hours of community service per week.

Any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called:  8:35 am  
Clerk: Kim
12CF703 and 15CM594
State appears in person by ADA Chad Minder;  Defendant appears in person and with Atty Dave Casey;  Date and time set for plea hearing in 15CM594 and Review Hearing in 12CF703.
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to DRI Count 2 in 15CM594.  COURT grants.  State moves to w/draw motion to revoke DEOJ on count 1 in 12CF703 and extend for one year from today's date.  Upon successful completion of probation count 1 will be dismissed.  COURT grants.
PLEA: No contest
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
State addresses Court.  Atty Casey addresses Court.
COURT ORDERS:   Count 1-15CM594 >> SWH 1 year probation (concurrent to any other sentence).  Conditions:  Any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed by agent, good faith effort to obtain FTE/FTS or combination, if not, 10 hours CS per week, court costs, no DNA sample or surcharge and 1 day credit.  12CF703>>DEOJ extended until 9/15/16.  Upon successful completion of probation, count 1 will be dismissed.
Review Hearing in DA's office:  9/4/16 at 1:10 pm     
Adjourned:  8:50 am

Case Called: 3:46pm. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Chad Minder. Defendant appears prose. State indicates Defendant failed to appear for PTC  on 6/12/15 on 15CM594;  with open Deferred on 12CF703 and Atty Robin Kennedy is or is not representing Defendant.  COURT addresses missed appearance with Defendant. Defendant makes statements. State will not request forfeiture at this time. COURT admonishes defendant. Court gives Defendant another month to get counsel. 
DATES: Set Review in one month w/Court. Adjourned: 3:50pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
